UFL Assailed by Czech Organization 
   Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association made public a statement on Aug. 25 denouncing the United States for staging the "Ulji Focus Lens-05" joint military exercises in south Korea.
 The statement said that the military maneuvers arouse more serious concern as they were launched by the U.S. right after it declared that it had no intention to invade the DPRK.    
 We bitterly assail the U.S. and south Korean forces for kicking off the maneuvers on the eve of the six-party talks for discussing the confidence building and peaceful coexistence between the DPRK and the U.S., the statement noted, adding that the new criminal moves of the U.S. against the Korean people should be stopped unconditionally.

articles.title: Letters to Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Letters to Pyongyang Mission of AINDF 
   Pyongyang, Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A political party and organizations of the United States, Britain and Switzerland sent letters to the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front from August 10 to 14 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The Communist Party of the United States of America (Juche) in a letter said that the hearts of the members of the party are filled with profound reverence for Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of Korea, and leader Kim Jong Il.    
 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy in a letter said that the liberation of Korea ushered in a new era in which the sun of the nation's resurrection and freedom is shedding its brilliant rays. The liberation of Korea, the result of the armed struggle waged by the Anti-Japanese Guerrilla Army, proved the truth of Songun that an army alone can advance the cause of independence, the letter noted.
 The Swiss Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a letter said that Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, the three generals of Mt. Paektu, are the great persons born of Heaven. Korea's liberation was the great victory of the Songun revolution, it said, adding that Kim Jong Il, carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung, has wisely led the Korean people in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful nation under the banner of Songun and achieve the reunification of the country in the idea of "By our nation itself".

    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its national day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Uzbekistan would continue to develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president great success in his responsible work for the country's stability, unity and economic prosperity.

North Cooperation Team of Youth and Students Leaves for Inchon
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A cooperation team of youth and students headed by O Jong Hun, principal of Kum Song School, left here today to participate in the 16th Asian track and field championships which will take place in Inchon, south Korea.
 It was seen off at the airport by Minister of Education Kim Yong Jin, First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Kim Kyong Ho, Vice-Chairman of the National Reconciliation Council Ri Chung Bok and officials concerned.    
 Earlier, a sports team of the north headed by Director of the Secretariat of the Non-permanent State Physical Culture and Sports Commission Jang Son Gang arrived in Inchon on Aug. 27 to participate in the championships.

Attractive Tassel Dance
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Tassel dance is one of the spectacles in the grand mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" which is going on successfully at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang.
 Performers dance well the tassel dance, turning round tassels with long strings on the top of three-story human pyramids in Scene 4 "Our Thriving Country" of Act 2. 
 From olden times, the Korean people have used to wear tassel hats with feathers, slips of paper or ribbons when dancing the peasant dance popular among them.
 The longest ribbon of the tassel is 18 meters long.    
 The dance presents a spectacular sight when those wearing tassel hats turn round, revolving the tassels with such long strings, and male and female dancers dance around them.    
 The tassel dance has developed with skilful rhythmic movements.

articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Symposium Held
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological symposium for natural environmental protection and improvement of the management of sanctuaries was held at the Grand People's Study House Wednesday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the DPRK Natural Conservation Union.
 Presented at the symposium were more than 30 papers on scientific and technological achievements and experience worthy to be introduced to practice.
 They included those papers on the work to convert the whole country into a thick woodland and greenery and their conservation, prevention of forest fire, effective prevention of damage by harmful insects, the reuse and purification of industrial leftovers, the rational use and management of water resources, conservation and management of land resources, the way of preventing land erosion and increasing soil fertility, the ecological and environmental change brought about by the construction of waterways and their protection and agricultural technology for ecological protection.
 Also introduced there were research achievements gained in the establishment of sanctuaries and their management, estimation of bio-diversity, protection of animals and plants in danger and those rare ones, ecological and environmental protection and education and information service for masses.    
 Present at the symposium were officials, scientists and technicians in the field of ecological and natural environmental protection from across the country.
 Prizes went to those who presented successful papers.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Symposium Held

Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Monstrous Crimes
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities should opt to settle Japan's past crimes as early as possible, bearing deep in mind that they can never justify nor erase Japan's blood-stained past history.
 A spokesman for the Association of Korean Victims of Forcible Drafting and Their Bereaved Families demanded this in a statement issued Wednesday denouncing the massacre of Koreans in Japan committed by the Japanese reactionaries right after the Kanto quake in 1923.    
 September every year brings to the Korean people's minds the monstrous massacre of Koreans committed by the beast-like Japanese imperialists after the Kanto quake, lashing them into simmering indignation, the statement says, and goes on:
 The Japanese authorities have not yet properly probed the truth about this mass killing though more than 80 years have passed since then. Worse still, they are evading the responsibility to reflect on, apologize and compensate for the massacre.
 The terror-ridden atmosphere created by right-wing gangsters of Japan through campaigns against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan reminds one of the situation in the wake of the Kanto quake.
 The statement bitterly condemned the desperate anti-DPRK moves of the authorities and right-wing reactionaries of Japan on behalf of all Korean victims of Japan's past crimes and their bereaved families.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Monstrous Crimes
